metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4609 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the get_len function in libavutil/lzo.c in Libav before 0.8.13, 9.x before 9.14, and 10.x before 10.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted Literal Run.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4609` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libav-tools - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavcodec-extra-54 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavcodec54 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavdevice-extra-53 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavdevice53 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavfilter-extra-3 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavfilter3 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavformat-extra-54 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavformat54 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavresample1 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavutil-extra-52 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavutil52 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libswscale-extra-2 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libswscale2 - 6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6:9.14-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
